title: Business & Finance
text:
Tesla accused the SEC of harassing Musk over his compliance with a regulatory settlement that sought to restrict his use of social media.

NHTSA is investigating Tesla over customer complaints that its most popular vehicles brake for unexpected reasons.

---

Fed nominee Raskin is struggling to overcome resistance from Republicans on a Senate panel for which she once served as a lawyer.

---

Walmart reported stronger sales over the winter holiday shopping season and said it is largely absorbing higher costs.

---

Federal and state regulators have widened their probes into how Activision's leadership handled workplace misconduct claims.

---

Federal prosecutors charged former Infinity Q investment chief James Velissaris with securities fraud and obstruction of justice.

---

Amazon.com and Visa reached an agreement allowing customers to use Visa credit cards across Amazon's websites and shops.

---

Airbus posted a record profit while tempering expectations for sharply boosting production of its A320 jet.

---

Brazilian meatpacker JBS said it scrapped plans to buy the rest of U.S. chicken processor Pilgrim's Pride.
